title: Jedis Pool : create new connections on exhaust
body:
We are using redis for caching purpose in our application.

Our aim is to create new connections whenever the existing pool gets exhausted, so that we can keep the number of idle connections minimal.This way a redis-server resource is given to an application-server(s) which really requires it.

Till now we were using JedisConnectionFactory of spring-data-redis 1.4.2 which uses Jedis 2.6.2 and commons-pool 2.0 version which does not have option of whenExhaustAction like earlier versions.

Please suggest how can we achieve this.
